product_name: OLAPLEXNo.10 Curl Defining Frizz Reducing Hair Gel
summary: SummaryHighlightsVeganPowered by Patented OLAPLEX Bond Building Technology and ultra-caring Curl Retention Compound, to repair, relink and strengthen broken disulfide bonds. Waves, curls and coils are instantly more defined, shaped and revived with a touchably soft, bouncy, high-shine finish.
details: DetailsBenefitsDefines curls with flexible, all-day hold–no residueStrengthens hair and gives 450ºF/232ºC heat protectionKey IngredientsPatented OLAPLEX Bond Technology™ Strengthens hair and repairs damage on a molecular level by rebuilding the disulfide bonds that give hair its strength.Curl Retention Compound A blend of highly humidity-resistant, flexible polymers, plant collagen, sugars that form a curl-locking barrier to enhance definition, smoothness, and healthy shine.Coconut-Avocado Hair Milk High in Lauric Acid, fatty acids, and essential vitamins to help fortify curls, reduce breakage, nourish, and condition for soft, shiny curls.Research Results3X greater curl retention* & 96% agree natural curl pattern is enhanced90% agree curls maintained hydration after 7 days***Clinically proven.**Based on a consumer perception study of 130 participants after 1 use; 7 days of use.Item 2629122How To UseApply and evenly distribute a small amount to clean, wet hair in sections.Scrunch in an upward motion to enhance natural curl pattern, or use desired curl-defining technique.Air dry or diffuse until dry.Once dry, gently scrunch to release curl cast for frizz-free curls.IngredientsWater/Aqua/Eau, Xylitylglucoside, Hydroxyethylcellulose, Anhydroxylitol, Bis-Aminopropyl Diglycol Dimaleate, Glycerin, Propanediol, Maltitol, Polyimide-1, Guar Hydroxypropyltrimonium Chloride, Hydroxypropyl Starch Phosphate, Caprylyl/Capryl Glucoside, Xylitol, Aspergillus Ferment, Acacia Senegal Gum, Ethylhexylglycerin, Cetyl Hydroxyethylcellulose, Polyquaternium-10, Glycolipids, Arginine, Cocos Nucifera (Coconut) Oil, Persea Gratissima (Avocado) Oil, Sodium Cocoyl Glutamate, Olive Oil Polyglyceryl-6 Esters, Sodium Hydroxide, Citric Acid, Trisodium Ethylenediamine Disuccinate, Glyceryl Caprylate, Glyceryl Stearate, PG-Hydroxyethylcellulose Cocodimonium Chloride, Lactic Acid, Cetearyl Alcohol, Cocos Nucifera (Coconut) Fruit Juice, Cocos Nucifera Water, Glyceryl Undecylenate, Phospholipids, Polyglyceryl-10 Dioleate, Polyglyceryl-10 Oleate, Sodium Stearoyl Lactylate, Pelvetia Canaliculata Extract, Disodium Phosphate, Hydrated Silica, Silica Dimethyl Silylate, Phenoxyethanol, Potassium Sorbate, Sodium Benzoate, Fragrance (Parfum), Limonene, Hexyl Cinnamal, Linalool, Citral, CitronellolShipping & Coupon RestrictionsThis brand is excluded from most Ulta Beauty coupons.See brand eligibility details
how_to_use: Apply and evenly distribute a small amount to clean, wet hair in sections.Scrunch in an upward motion to enhance natural curl pattern, or use desired curl-defining technique.Air dry or diffuse until dry.Once dry, gently scrunch to release curl cast for frizz-free curls.

reviews.headline: Not what I expected, unfortunately
reviews.comments: I bought this with hopes that it was good for curly hair, but it doesn't give really any curl definition and left my hair dry. I purchased online, and the nearest store is 35 miles away from me, so if I want to return it, I have to pay for the shipping. So, now I'm not only dissatisfied with the product, I'm dissatisfied with ULTA! What a horrible way to show gratitude to your customers!

reviews.headline: THEE Best Gel on the market rn
reviews.comments: This is the only gel I've used that nourishes my wavy/curly hair and gives it body without making it too crunch or "wet" looking. So so good.

reviews.headline: New step in my wavy routine
reviews.comments: The Olaplex No. 10 Curl Defining Gel is a lightweight, non-sticky gel that enhances natural wave patterns without adding heaviness to the hair, making it perfect for wavy types 2a–2b–2c. It carries the signature clean, salon-like Olaplex scent that I personally enjoy every time I use it. Waves don't last for several days, so keep that in mind.

reviews.headline: Strength Meets Definition for Curls That Last
reviews.comments:
Olaplex, a brand renowned for its bond-repairing technology, has introduced the Nº.10 Bond Shaper™ Curl Defining Gel, extending their innovative science into the realm of curls. As someone with naturally wavy-to-curly hair prone to dryness and frizz, I was eager to test this product, particularly since Olaplex claims it not only defines curls but also strengthens them from within.

What sets Nº.10 apart from typical curl gels is its incorporation of Olaplex's patented bond-building technology, which repairs and rebuilds broken disulfide bonds in the hair. This is particularly significant for those with curly hair, as textured hair types are more susceptible to breakage and damage due to their unique structure. The concept of a styling gel that also functions as a reparative treatment is indeed promising.

Upon first impression, the gel is packaged in a sleek, easy-to-use tube and has a medium consistency that strikes a balance between thick and runny. It applies smoothly and creamy, allowing for even distribution through wet or damp hair. I was pleased to discover that it dries without feeling sticky or crunchy, and it can be layered without creating that undesirable "helmet hair" effect, which is often a concern for individuals with curly hair.

The scent is characteristic of Olaplex — clean, light, and fresh — and it fades pleasantly as the hair dries. It complements rather than competes with other fragrances, making it suitable for layering with leave-in conditioners or curl creams without overwhelming your senses.

In terms of application and styling, I applied it to soaking-wet hair after my leave-in conditioner, lightly raking it through in sections and scrunching for curl formation. For added definition, I used the "praying hands" technique to smooth it along the strands before scrunching again. The product creates a light cast as it dries, which can be easily scrunched out for soft, touchable curls. If a more sculpted look is desired, simply apply a bit more and allow the cast to remain; either way, it maintains a flexible texture without stiffness or flakiness.

I was particularly impressed by its versatility. I've used it on days when I complete a full wash-and-style routine, as well as on refresh days when I simply mist my curls and reapply a bit of gel for added definition. In both scenarios, it provided bounce, hold, and frizz control without any buildup or greasiness.

The performance of the Olaplex Nº.10 Bond Shaper is commendable. My curls were defined, shiny, and noticeably softer. Unlike some curl gels that prioritize definition at the cost of moisture, this product appears to enhance hydration. My curls retained their shape with minimal frizz even on day two and day three, which is uncommon for my hair type. I also observed less tangling throughout the day and increased elasticity in my curls, indicating that the bond-repair aspect is effectively contributing to hair health.

Additionally, this product is free from sulfates, parabens, phthalates, and silicones, making it an excellent choice for those following the Curly Girl Method or seeking a clean haircare routine. It is also vegan and cruelty-free, consistent with the rest of the Olaplex line.

Who would benefit most from this product? If you have wavy, curly, or coily hair and seek a styling product that not only defines but also strengthens, Olaplex Nº.10 is an exceptional option. It works harmoniously with other styling products like creams or mousses and layers beautifully to achieve your preferred level of hold. This gel is particularly beneficial for those who have experienced curl damage from heat styling, coloring, or relaxing, and are looking to promote long-term curl health while achieving outstanding style results.

One consideration is the price point — like all Olaplex products, it is on the higher end, retailing for approximately $30. However, considering the small amount needed for each application and its dual function as a reparative treatment, I believe it is a worthwhile investment. It serves not only as a styling product but also as a strengthening treatment integrated into your styling routine, reducing the need for multiple products.

In conclusion, the Olaplex Nº.10 Bond Shaper™ Curl Defining Gel represents a significant advancement in curly hair care. It seamlessly combines high-performance styling with clinically-backed repair. Whether you prefer wash-and-go curls, twist-outs, or diffused volume, this gel ensures your curls remain defined, touchable, and resilient. It embodies the qualities expected from Olaplex — innovation, quality, and results — and is a must-try for anyone looking to enhance their curl routine while fostering long-term strength from within.

reviews.headline: Great Product but....
reviews.comments:
I have very curly hair and use this product everyday after I wash my hair.
When used correctly it works wonders and leaves my curls frizz free all day.
However, I do not enjoy the smell of this product by any means it is fishy and weird.
My other issue is the cap is faulty and this leaks everywhere.
I would be fine if it was a upright container but it is a soft bottle that must remain upside down.
It is kind of sticky but if you scrunch it in all the way it wont leave a cast.
Overall I love the results but this specific product needs some improvement.

reviews.headline: Solid styling gel
reviews.comments:
Pros: Easy packaging, which is great for getting every ounce of product! The texture mixed well with my curl foam and cream products. Also, scent free is a bonus for anyone that is sensitive to fragrances (migraines, etc).
Cons: hold is not as strong as other gels I have tried, so I need to use a little more product than I'm used to. Couldn't get good frizz control without using a decent amount.

reviews.headline: Amazing Results for Thick, Curly Hair!
reviews.comments:
I have incredibly thick, curly hair that frizzes and even matts together really easily, and this product has truly helped with that! Olaplex No. 10 defines my curls right away — all I did was rake it through damp, detangled hair, and it immediately gave my curls a beautiful, bouncy shape. Even better, it kept them hydrated throughout the week, which is usually when my hair starts to frizz. With this gel, the frizz was minimal — a huge improvement compared to usual.
The only reason I'm giving it 4 stars instead of 5 is that, at least for my hair type, I need to use a pretty generous amount to get full coverage. It's not a deal-breaker, but it is a bit unsatisfying since the bottle doesn't hold as much product as it appears to.
Overall, though, I'm super happy with it and will definitely be repurchasing!

reviews.headline: Finally frizz free curls
reviews.comments: I tried everything for my curls. This is fantastic! Light clean scent. Not overpowering at all. Thrilled! You will be too!

reviews.headline: Love this
reviews.comments: I absolutely loved this product! It definitely cuts down frizz and enhances your curls and shine. My only negative about this product is the smell is very clinical and medicinal smelling. I normally prefer a product that will enhance the smell of my hair as well. The cut down on frizz though does make this product still worth it to me, and the scent alone does not deter me from buying this product. The products packaging is very simple and I like that as it makes it easy to identify the product in store. It comes with a lot of product in it and seems like it will last me a decent amount of time. I would definitely recommend this frizz fighting curl cream to anyone with curly hair and is looking for a new product to save their hair in the summer.

reviews.headline: No frizz no brainer
reviews.comments: No I have used Curl Defining Frizz Reducing Hair Gel for some time. First of all i want to say thst i does all what it claims to: it does give me mo frizz medium hold and also defining my naturally wavy hair. Now, my hair type is wavy but sometimes its more or less defined depending on the climate or the water. Id say it didn't stay as textured as i thought but i wont take a star off becaise i gave tried it in a pretty humid climate when my hair are more naturally straighten out. I like the texture of the product because it doesn't make my hair feel stuck or glued together like some other texturizing products do. It has a ligh smell. No issues with that. I would suggest to give it a try! This product was provided for promotional purposes in exchange for my honest review

reviews.headline: Great gel
reviews.comments: I have tried so many different gels for curly hair and this one has definitely made it to my top all time favorites that I have ever used. It maintains my frizz all day long and makes my curls look so good and hydrated and enhances the texture. I never have a bad hair day with this gel. It also doesn't leave any residue or white flakes the way some other gels do. My hair absorbs it so well and it has become a part of my every day hair care routine when getting ready for the day. I would highly recommend this to anyone considering it. I get so many compliments on my hair every time I use it and I just have to share and let people know what product I used to make it look so good lol no gate keeping here!

reviews.headline: Perfect for 4C super curly/ coily hair!
reviews.comments:
This curling gel definitely exceeded my expectations.

 Normally I don't have very high expectations when using a product that claims to define my curls without making it crunchy. However, this curl designer has changed my mind completely. I used the product after using the Olaplex shampoo and conditioner and I applied it while my hair was still wet.  I have 4C curls so I was pretty hesitant that this product would smooth my curls without making my hair crunchy or not giving any hold at all. 

I did as the product recommended and used a very small amount to distribute through my hair in small sections. I had recently cut my hair, so I'm actually experimenting with a new style with this product being the very first try on my newly short hair. After I ran it through my hair sections I did some very small finger coils in my hair. While using it, I could absolutely tell that the product was smoothing it. It was really easy to comb through as well too. It also felt very light weight as well not heavy at all. 

After my hair dried, I could tell that my coils had some hold to it, but it did not at all feel crunchy. I will say if anyone is looking to use this definitely be sure to follow the instructions and use it on wet hair and use a very small amount literally a little goes a long way. I'm very excited to use this product on a washing go and maybe on a rod set in the near future!

reviews.headline: Best and recommended curl defining gel
reviews.comments: Thank you for this gift. I love its ability to do and define curls with creating bouncy and healthy curls. Also it is very soft and not sticky texture. Very effective from the 1st use. Moisturize the hair for long hours. Long lasting defining curling gel. Also the best part for this product that it makes the frizzy hair go away which makes the hair very silky and soft and shiny curls. Enhancing the curls. Embracing the curls. It's very good for all hair types.

reviews.headline: A must
reviews.comments: This is such a great gel for curls! My hair has no frizz my curls look great and are not crunchy. There is no white cast which is a must for me when looking for a gel. This makes my hair smell amazing such a great product!

reviews.headline: nice
reviews.comments: So far I do like this product but I do feel like it leaves your hair greasy looking if you have darker hair, even if using a smaller amount. It holds well and helps scrunch your hair good as well. I would suggest this to people to use its simple and a little goes a long way so you def will have it for awhile. I am always trying to find new hair products to help my curls and I think this one will now be a staple. My hair is less frizzy when I use this product as well which is a huge thing for me. I am always switching it up between gels and creams and this gel is not super sticky like they usually are so it doesn't leave your hair crunch or gross it honestly just feels like nothing is in your hair. I recommend trying this out if you have curly hair like me and see what you think of it!

reviews.headline: Instant curl enhancement
reviews.comments: As someone with naturally curly hair, I was really excited to try the Olaplex No. 10 Bonding Hair Gel, to keep my curls defined. So I wanted to put the product to the test on straightened hair and my curls instantly reverted back. I like it

reviews.headline: Love love love!
reviews.comments: I've been using the Olaplex No. 10 Bond Shaper Curl Defining Gel for a week now and it has completely elevated how I style and protect my hair. I often wear my hair in a slicked-back bun, which can lead to frizz, dryness, and breakage over time. This gel gives me the perfect hold without the crunch, and it actually nourishes my curls underneath the style. Unlike most gels that flake or dry out my hair, No. 10 feels hydrating and lightweight, with great definition and shine. Even after hours in a bun, my curls feel soft and springy when I take it down—no stiffness or buildup. I also love that it's infused with the signature Olaplex bond-building technology, so I know it's helping my hair stay strong while I style it. Overall, I love that I can have a sleek look but doesn't my sacrifice curl health.

media.headline: Love this for repairing my curly hair!
Leaves my waves defined and with no frizz
Leaves my waves defined and with no frizz
A Curl Gel with Reparative Properties!

faceoff_positive.comments:
Olaplex, a brand renowned for its bond-repairing technology, has introduced the Nº.10 Bond Shaper™ Curl Defining Gel, extending their innovative science into the realm of curls. As someone with naturally wavy-to-curly hair prone to dryness and frizz, I was eager to test this product, particularly since Olaplex claims it not only defines curls but also strengthens them from within.

What sets Nº.10 apart from typical curl gels is its incorporation of Olaplex's patented bond-building technology, which repairs and rebuilds broken disulfide bonds in the hair. This is particularly significant for those with curly hair, as textured hair types are more susceptible to breakage and damage due to their unique structure. The concept of a styling gel that also functions as a reparative treatment is indeed promising.

Upon first impression, the gel is packaged in a sleek, easy-to-use tube and has a medium consistency that strikes a balance between thick and runny. It applies smoothly and creamy, allowing for even distribution through wet or damp hair. I was pleased to discover that it dries without feeling sticky or crunchy, and it can be layered without creating that undesirable "helmet hair" effect, which is often a concern for individuals with curly hair.

The scent is characteristic of Olaplex — clean, light, and fresh — and it fades pleasantly as the hair dries. It complements rather than competes with other fragrances, making it suitable for layering with leave-in conditioners or curl creams without overwhelming your senses.

In terms of application and styling, I applied it to soaking-wet hair after my leave-in conditioner, lightly raking it through in sections and scrunching for curl formation. For added definition, I used the "praying hands" technique to smooth it along the strands before scrunching again. The product creates a light cast as it dries, which can be easily scrunched out for soft, touchable curls. If a more sculpted look is desired, simply apply a bit more and allow the cast to remain; either way, it maintains a flexible texture without stiffness or flakiness.

I was particularly impressed by its versatility. I've used it on days when I complete a full wash-and-style routine, as well as on refresh days when I simply mist my curls and reapply a bit of gel for added definition. In both scenarios, it provided bounce, hold, and frizz control without any buildup or greasiness.

The performance of the Olaplex Nº.10 Bond Shaper is commendable. My curls were defined, shiny, and noticeably softer. Unlike some curl gels that prioritize definition at the cost of moisture, this product appears to enhance hydration. My curls retained their shape with minimal frizz even on day two and day three, which is uncommon for my hair type. I also observed less tangling throughout the day and increased elasticity in my curls, indicating that the bond-repair aspect is effectively contributing to hair health.

Additionally, this product is free from sulfates, parabens, phthalates, and silicones, making it an excellent choice for those following the Curly Girl Method or seeking a clean haircare routine. It is also vegan and cruelty-free, consistent with the rest of the Olaplex line.

Who would benefit most from this product? If you have wavy, curly, or coily hair and seek a styling product that not only defines but also strengthens, Olaplex Nº.10 is an exceptional option. It works harmoniously with other styling products like creams or mousses and layers beautifully to achieve your preferred level of hold. This gel is particularly beneficial for those who have experienced curl damage from heat styling, coloring, or relaxing, and are looking to promote long-term curl health while achieving outstanding style results.

One consideration is the price point — like all Olaplex products, it is on the higher end, retailing for approximately $30. However, considering the small amount needed for each application and its dual function as a reparative treatment, I believe it is a worthwhile investment. It serves not only as a styling product but also as a strengthening treatment integrated into your styling routine, reducing the need for multiple products.

In conclusion, the Olaplex Nº.10 Bond Shaper™ Curl Defining Gel represents a significant advancement in curly hair care. It seamlessly combines high-performance styling with clinically-backed repair. Whether you prefer wash-and-go curls, twist-outs, or diffused volume, this gel ensures your curls remain defined, touchable, and resilient. It embodies the qualities expected from Olaplex — innovation, quality, and results — and is a must-try for anyone looking to enhance their curl routine while fostering long-term strength from within.
faceoff_positive.headline: Strength Meets Definition for Curls That Last

faceoff_negative.comments:
As a first time user of Olaplex Nº.10 Bond Shaper™ Curl Defining Gel, I found the outcome didn't entirely meet the desired results I was hoping for. With coarse, wiry hair as a melanated early middle-aged woman, my strands has a high porosity. The gel also left my hair feeling dry with dandruffs after it has air-dried. Mind you, I didn't include any hair grease/ oil because I didn't want my hair becoming weighed down, giving a slick appearance. But, on a positive note, the lightweight, transparent gel has a mild and delightful scent, glides effortlessly and evenly throughout my hair, somewhat enhanced my afro-textured coils, softness, and I've noticed strengthening due to the breakage after the usage of hot tools. I try my best to stay away from flat ironing, hotcombing, blowdrying, etc. due to my hair being prone to breakage easily along with frizzyness. But, I'm torn in between wanting to stretch/straighten my hair to get rid of the poofyness and embracing the natural look. Lets be real- handling textured hair can be a pain. That's where the Olaplex Nº.10 Bond Shaper gel comes in place. I do recommend Olaplex gel for all hair types, especially those with curly/coily/kinky textured hair. Keep in mind that there isn't any "one fits all" ordeal because everyone's hair is different. We as people have more or less needs than others may have. Next time, a different approach  will be planned when using the gel.

*This product was provided for promotional purposes in exchange for my honest review
faceoff_negative.headline: Leaves Behind Residue
